main event: On May 3, 1958, a military observation in Flagstaff, Arizona reported an elongated balloon-like object seen on radar at 35,000 feet.
interesting points: The object was described as blimp-type and picked up on radar despite interference,The length of the observation was 15 minutes,An additional sighting was reported on May 7 involving a pilot seeing a flashing light moving at a constant velocity,The pilot estimated the object's altitude between 4,000 to 5,000 feet,The weather conditions during the observation were clear with good visibility.
witness description: Military personnel including a pilot and crew from the U.S. Air Force.
